snippet: Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta warned that the United States was facing the possibility of a “cyber-Pearl Harbor” and was increasingly vulnerable to foreign computer hackers.
abstract: Defense Secretary Leon E Panetta warns United States is facing possibility of a 'cyber-Pearl Harbor' and is increasingly vulnerable to foreign computer hackers who could dismantle nation's power grid, transportation system, financial networks and government;  says he is reacting to increasing aggressiveness and technological advances by China, Russia, Iran and militant groups.

byline.original: By ELISABETH BUMILLER and THOM SHANKER
byline.contributor: Elisabeth Bumiller reported from New York, and Thom Shanker from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta warned that the United States was facing the possibility of a “cyber-Pearl Harbor” and was increasingly vulnerable to foreign computer hackers.

headline.main:
Panetta Warns of
Dire Threat of
Cyberattack on U.S.
headline.print_headline: Panetta Warns Of Dire Threat Of Cyberattack

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
